CatDescriptText: Eunice Richardson, teacher, Schenley Heights and Paul Pandoff, retired, Perryopolis were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 5, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think voters will choose the Republican or the Democratic candidate for the presidency?"  Mrs. Richardson's answer reads: "It's hard to say at this time."  Mr. Pandoff's answer reads: "Republican, because we're having peace."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Eunice Richardson wearing eyeglasses and overcoat with wide collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Paul Pandoff wearing tweed overcoat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
